pullRequest.title: [0255] Enchance body information
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #1234
This PR is [ready] for review.
Related PR's
Core
HMI
Risk
This PR makes [minor] API changes.
Testing Plan

 I have verified that I have not introduced new warnings in this PR (or explain why below)
 I have run the unit tests with this PR
 I have tested this PR against Core and verified behavior (if applicable, if not applicable, explain why below).
 I have tested Android, Java SE, and Java EE

Unit Tests
Added unit tests for the new structures
Summary
Changes according to #1234
CLA

 I have signed the CLA

commit.message:
[0255]
- Implement changes according to the latest specification

nodes.bodyText: @kostyaBoss you can revert this change.  No changes are needed in MainActivity.java.
@kostyaBoss You can remove the unused import GateStatus on line 5.
@kostyaBoss You can remove line 27 msg.setStatus(...) since you are already setting the status using the DoorStatus constructor.

@kostyaBoss I would delete line 36 and replace it with
assertEquals(TestValues.MATCH, TestValues.GENERAL_GRID, location);
@kostyaBoss I would rename this file to GateStatusTests.java.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,66 @@
+package com.smartdevicelink.test.rpc.datatypes;

nodes.bodyText: @kostyaBoss You can remove line 26  (msg.setStatus(...)) since you are already setting the status using the DoorStatus constructor.

@kostyaBoss I would delete line 35 (assertTrue(Validator.validateGrid(...)) and replace it with
assertEquals(TestValues.MATCH, TestValues.GENERAL_GRID, location);

@kostyaBoss I would delete line 36 (assertTrue(Validator.validateGrid(...)`) and replace it with
assertEquals(TestValues.MATCH, TestValues.GENERAL_GRID, location);
@kostyaBoss Below line 37 I would add this line assertEquals(TestValues.MATCH, TestValues.GENERAL_WINDOW_STATE, windowState);

@kostyaBoss It looks like you used the code generator tool to re-generate the entire file.  Can you just merge in the changes that are specific to this PR (in the HTML these would be the parameters from driverDoorAjar to roofStatuses)?

nodes.bodyText: @kostyaBoss I think you can revert these changes, as vehicle data does not need to be changed for this PR.  The corresponding PR for the JavaScript suite (https://github.com/smartdevicelink/sdl_javascript_suite/pull/354/files) did not make changes to the vehicle data.

You can delete the unused import on line 8.

It seems that there are some spacing issues here.

nodes.bodyText: The indentation for since & deprecated is not consistent in this file
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -38,78 +38,118 @@ import com.smartdevicelink.proxy.rpc.enums.IgnitionStatus; import java.util.Hashtable; +import java.util.List; /** - * The body information including power modes. - * - *

Note: The structure defines the information about the park brake and ignition.

* *

Parameter List

* * * * - * * - * + * + * + * * * * * - * - * - * + * + * + * + * * * * * - * - * - * + * + * + * + * * * * * - * - * - * - * - * - * - * - * - * - * + * + * + * + * * * * * - * - * - * + * + * + * + * * * * * - * - * - * + * + * + * + * * * * * - * - * - * + * + * + * + *
Param NameTypeMandatoryDescriptionVersionRequiredNotesVersion Available
parkBrakeActiveBooleantrueDescribes, if the park break is active. The information about the park brake: - true, if active - false if not.SmartDeviceLink 2.0References signal "PrkBrkActv_B_Actl".Y
ignitionStableStatusIgnitionStableStatustrueDescribes, if the ignition situation is considered stableThe information about stability of the ignition switch. See {@linkplain IgnitionStableStatus}SmartDeviceLink 2.0References signal "Ignition_Switch_Stable". See IgnitionStableStatus.Y
ignitionStatusIgnitionStatustrueThe information about ignition status. See {@linkplain IgnitionStatus}SmartDeviceLink 2.0
parkBrakeActiveBooleantrueThe information about the park brake: - true, if active - false if not.SmartDeviceLink 2.0References signal "Ignition_status". See IgnitionStatus.Y
driverDoorAjarBooleantrueThe information about the park brake: - true, if active - false if not.SmartDeviceLink 2.0References signal "DrStatDrv_B_Actl". Deprecated starting with RPC Spec 7.1.0.N + * @since SmartDeviceLink 2.0.0 + * @deprecated in SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 + *
passengerDoorAjarBooleantrueThe information about the park brake: - true, if active - false if not.SmartDeviceLink 2.0References signal "DrStatPsngr_B_Actl". Deprecated starting with RPC Spec 7.1.0.N + * @since SmartDeviceLink 2.0.0 + * @deprecated in SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 + *
rearLeftDoorAjarBooleantrueThe information about the park brake: - true, if active - false if not.SmartDeviceLink 2.0References signal "DrStatRl_B_Actl". Deprecated starting with RPC Spec 7.1.0.N + * @since SmartDeviceLink 2.0.0

nodes.bodyText: It seems that the Javadoc for pre-existing fields has been updated in this PR. Can we revert that and only add/modify Javadoc for the fields that got modified/introduced in the proposal?
nodes.diffHunk:

Note: The structure defines the information about the park brake and ignition.

* *

Parameter List

* * * * - * * - * + * + * + * * * * * - * - * - * + *
Param NameTypeMandatoryDescriptionVersionRequiredNotesVersion Available
parkBrakeActiveBooleantrueDescribes, if the park break is active. The information about the park brake: - true, if active - false if not.SmartDeviceLink 2.0References signal "PrkBrkActv_B_Actl".

nodes.bodyText: The unit tests on the PR currently fail because of an issue in develop branch. The issue got fixed on develop branch for Java Suite. Please merge develop into your branch and make sure that unit tests pass on the PR.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -175,41 +247,177 @@ public IgnitionStatus getIgnitionStatus() {
         return (IgnitionStatus) getObject(IgnitionStatus.class, KEY_IGNITION_STATUS);
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Sets the driverDoorAjar.
+     *
+     * @param driverDoorAjar References signal "DrStatDrv_B_Actl". Deprecated starting with RPC Spec 7.1.0.
+     * @since SmartDeviceLink 2.0.0
+     * @deprecated in SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0
+     */
+    @Deprecated

nodes.bodyText: please replace this * SmartDeviceLink 2.0 with that: * * @since SmartDeviceLink 2.0.0 * @deprecated in SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 * For driverDoorAjar, passengerDoorAjar, rearLeftDoorAjar, rearRightDoorAjar to indicate that they are deprecated
